title: Hour 1: House of Cards
description:
In this episode, Ryan Clark, Channing Crowder, and Domonique Foxworth react to Kyler Murray's massive contract extension with the Cardinals that includes a certain clause requiring him to do his homework. After an anonymous defensive coordinator labeled Lamar Jackson a second-tier quarterback, the crew decides if the comments were fair or foul. Plus, Ryan, Channing, and Domonique debate the future of the Kansas City Chiefs after Tyreek Hill's move to Miami. Bill Belichick and the Patriots still haven't named key positions of their coaching staff, which begs the question: Is this another one of Bill's tricks or is New England in trouble? Our guys have the answer.
Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices
itunes:author: ESPN, Stephen A. Smith, Molly Qerim Rose
itunes:subtitle: First Take Hour 1: Does a film study clause in Kyler's contract look worse for him or the Cardinals?
